title: California, Indiana Students to Hear from Astronauts on Space Station
summary: Students from California and Indiana, along with staff members at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) in Southern California, will have the opportunity this week to hear from astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: SpaceX rolls out Falcon 9 rocket as Starship work continues at pad 39A
summary: SpaceX continues to launch Falcon 9 rockets from Launch Complex 39A in Florida as construction work advances on the nearby tower for the company’s next-generation Starship rocket. Overnight Tuesday, SpaceX rolled another Falcon 9 to pad 39A for liftoff with the next batch of Starlink internet satellites, just hours after another section of the Starship gantry tower arrived at the pad.

title: Busek finds headroom to double in size
summary: Busek is rapidly expanding its staff and facilities in response to strong demand for spacecraft propulsion.

title: Galactic Energy of China registers third consecutive successful launch
summary: Chinese commercial launch service provider Galactic Energy maintained a 100 percent launch record early Tuesday with its third Ceres-1 solid rocket launch.

title: TransAstra and Slooh to offer students asteroid detection tool
summary: Space logistics startup TransAstronautica announced a partnership Aug. 9 with online astronomy platform Slooh to offer U.S. schools access to a global telescope network of ground-based and space-based telescopes.

title: Benchmark unveils small satellite collision-avoidance kit
summary: Benchmark Space Systems unveiled a collision avoidance kit designed to help small satellites dodge debris and steer clear of other spacecraft.

title: Northrop Grumman partners with Firefly and SpaceX to save Antares rocket, launch Cygnus spacecraft
summary: Northrop Grumman has announced plans to partner with startup Firefly Aerospace to save (and upgrade) the conglomerate’s Antares rocket, which it uses...

title: Launch startup SpaceRyde fortifies advisory board
summary: Canadian launch startup SpaceRyde said Aug. 8 it has added a second member to its advisory board with the appointment of Mina Mitry, the CEO of small satellite operator Kepler Communications.

title: Beck: CAPSTONE demonstrates feasibility of low-cost interplanetary smallsats
summary: Rocket Lab’s launch of a NASA lunar cubesat mission lived up to its name, serving as a capstone for the company’s efforts to develop end-to-end space systems and interplanetary missions, according to its chief executive.

title: NASA looking for new launch of remaining TROPICS cubesats
summary: NASA is investigating alternative ways to launch four Earth science cubesats after Astra discontinued the rocket originally contracted to launch them.
